page.title: 20BONFIRE NIGHT
page.content: Several nights before{November 5th, the scouts were out collecting wood on strange trailer-like contraptions and taking it to Lower Farm for the {bonfire. }As the loads continued, the bonfire grew until it was 5 or 6 metres high. {A guy}was made from old clothes & straw stuffing & it was placed on the top. Approximately{Â£200 {worth of fireworks}were bought and fixed in groups around the area. Ropes guarded the centre of the field so the public would be{safe. Tickets were available from two weeks before & admission was available on the night but more expensive. People flocked in. Hot_dogs,sparklers and hot drinks were on sale. It went very well and was very enjoyable. Â£200 went up in smoke but the scouts got it back in gate money and the community enjoyed it.
